newsitem.title: JAPAN: Asian oil product demand seen growing - Japan report.
newsitem.headline: Asian oil product demand seen growing - Japan report.

text.p: Demand for oil products in Asia is expected to outpace the region's refining capacity by 2000, a report drafted by a Japanese Trade Ministry panel said on Thursday.
The report said growth in demand for oil products in Asia should reach at least 5.1 percent a year by 2000, more than double the 2.1 percent annual growth projected for the world as a whole.
Particularly strong growth is expected in such countries as Thailand, China and India, where annual growth is expected to reach 7.4 percent, 6.6 percent and 4.0 percent, respectively.
Demand for oil products in Asia is expected to account for 18.5 percent of total world demand in 2000, up three percentage points from 1994.
Demand for gasoline in Asia is likely to reach 8.2 percent a year by 2000. Demand for gas oil is forecast to reach 5.0 percent, while kerosene and jet fuel will together total 5.4 percent.
The report said refining capacity in Asia would not be able to fully satisfy demand by 2000.
Among the countries and areas included in the study were China, South Korea, Taiwan, Hong Kong, Singapore, Brunei, Indonesia, Malaysia, Philippines, Thailand, India and Vietnam.
